alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 5:46PM CDT until May 27 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT/7 PM CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, Dundy and Hitchcock. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Saturday /700 PM CDT Saturday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 444 PM MDT /544 PM CDT/, Flooding is already occurring. Between 5 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. - Multiple roads and bridges across Dundy and Hitchcock counties are either washed out or under water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Benkelman, Trenton, Palisade, Stratton, Max and Parks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
